info.description: The Recruiting service enables applications to access Workday data about recruiting, such as job postings, prospects, and interviews.
info.title: recruiting

tags.name: jobPostings
tags.description: Provides the ability to retrieve job postings.

tags.name: prospects
tags.description: Provides the ability to retrieve and create prospect data.

tags.name: Prompt Values
tags.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service.

get.summary: Retrieves a single experience instance for a \~prospect\~.
get.description: Retrieves the work experience with the specified ID for the specified \~prospect\~. Secured by: Prospects Scope: Recruiting, Talent Pipeline

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of job postings.
get.description: Retrieves all job postings. You can filter by categories and job sites. Secured by: Job Postings: External Scope: Recruiting

parameters.name: jobPosting
parameters.description: Job Posting for Job Posting Anchor

parameters.name: jobRequisition
parameters.description: Job Requisition for Job Posting Anchor

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.description: Creates a single \~prospect\~ instance with the specified data. In the request body, specify at least the required field: candidate.name.country.id. The Recruiting Name Components configuration might require additional fields for candidate.name. To determine additional required fields, see the Recruiting Name Components tab on the Maintain Name Components by \~Country\~ task. Secured by: Create External Prospects, Set Up: External Career Site Access Scope: Recruiting

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A249 | You must enter the prospect’s email address or phone number.
A255 | Enter referral as the source when you enter referred by.
A256 | Enter a name.
A268 | Enter the referral for the prospect.
A269 | Enter an email address in this format: xxx@yy.com.
A274 | Enter a valid format for Phone Number.
A278 | Enter active candidate pools.
A284 | Enter active candidate tags.
A288 | Enter a phone number in the valid format: [PhoneValidationMessage]
A673 | The Phone Device Type that you specified must be Active.
A820 | Specify a value for Phone Device Type.
A821 | You can't specify a Phone Device Type that's Hidden for Recruiting.
A822 | Specify a value for Phone Number.
A823 | Specify a value for Country Phone Code.
A2517 | The email address you entered is invalid. Enter a valid email address.

post.description: Submits interview details for the processing \~worker\~ with the interviewer's rating and comment. Secured by: Interview Feedback Public API Scope: Recruiting

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A129 | You cannot take action on this candidate.
A130 | Select a valid rating.
A131 | You cannot submit interview feedback because you are not a part of the interview team.
A132 | Overall Comment Required (Configure Optional Fields) but not included.  Please contact your administrator.
A133 | Overall Rating is included but is hidden (Configure Optional Fields).  Please contact your administrator.
A134 | Overall Comment is included but is hidden (Configure Optional Fields).  Please contact your administrator.
A135 | Interview feedback task contains competencies, questionnaires, or both; complete feedback using Workday or the Give Interview Feedback URL provided by the API.
A136 | Overall Rating is Required (Configure Optional Fields) but not included.  Please contact your administrator.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of interviews. Secured by: Interview Feedback Public API Scope: Recruiting

parameters.name: interviewStatus
parameters.description:
"All applicable interview statuses for an Interview event. Statuses can be: 
 * AWAITING_ME - An in-progress Interview event is waiting for the logged-in user's feedback. 
 * COMPLETED - An Interview event is complete.
 * FEEDBACK_COMPLETE - All interview feedback for this in-progress event was submitted, but the Interview event isn’t awaiting the Make Interview Decision step.
 * NOT_SCHEDULED - An interview hasn't been scheduled for an in-progress Interview event.
 * PENDING_FEEDBACK - An in-progress Interview event is waiting for interviewer feedback.
 * SCHEDULED - An interview is scheduled for an in-progress Interview event.
 * SUBMITTED_FEEDBACK - The logged-in user submitted feedback for an in-progress Interview event.
 * MAKE_INTERVIEW_DECISION - The make an interview decision step for the candidate."

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves the \~prospect\~ with the specified ID. Secured by: Prospects, Set Up: External Career Site Access Scope: Recruiting, Talent Pipeline

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

code.description: The code that corresponds to the error message. Use the error code to drive programmatic error-handling behavior. Don't use error message strings for this purpose because they are subject to change

field.description: The field related to the error

path.description: The path of the field related to the error

items.description: This object represents the possible facets for this resource

facetParameter.description: The alias used to select the facet

count.description: The number of instances returned by this facet

jobRequisition_df78b8e577c9100015f051a74.description: The job requisition the candidate applied to. Requires that the user is an interviewer for the in-progress Interview event or has access  to the Candidate Data: Interview Feedback Results domain.

jobApplication_df78b8e577c91000201ea3e7d.description: The job application for the Recruiting event. Requires that the user is an interviewer for the in-progress Interview event or has access  to the Candidate Data: Interview Feedback Results domain.

interviewStatuses.description:
"All applicable interview statuses for an Interview event. Statuses can be: 
 * AWAITING_ME - An in-progress Interview event is waiting for the logged-in user's feedback. 
 * COMPLETED - An Interview event is complete.
 * FEEDBACK_COMPLETE - All interview feedback for this in-progress event was submitted, but the Interview event isn’t awaiting the Make Interview Decision step.
 * NOT_SCHEDULED - An interview hasn't been scheduled for an in-progress Interview event.
 * PENDING_FEEDBACK - An in-progress Interview event is waiting for interviewer feedback.
 * SCHEDULED - An interview is scheduled for an in-progress Interview event.
 * SUBMITTED_FEEDBACK - The logged-in user submitted feedback for an in-progress Interview event.
 * MAKE_INTERVIEW_DECISION - The make an interview decision step for the candidate."
